alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 2:54PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern DeSoto, southwestern Marshall and northeastern Tate Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 253 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hernando, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, Holly Springs, Byhalia, Independence, Lewisburg, Red Banks, Laws Hill, Marianna, Coal Oil Corner, Wakefield, Cockrum, Frees Corners, Aiken, Watson, Cedarview, Bright and Nesbit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
